subject: Re: Valentine's Day-related interactives
body:
On Feb. 10, at 01:13 PM, Chris Kirk wrote:

​Oops, think I accidentally knocked Forrest off this (eff, the email client I made doesn't work right). Forrest, I made an example of "guess the name of this sex position" quiz. If you agree with Laura, I can finish it up, probably for tomorrow pub if Art can make illustrations in time.

From: Laura Bennett
Sent: Tuesday, February 10, 2015 1:04 PM
To: Kirk, Chris
Subject: Re: Valentine's Day-related interactives
 
Talk about nsfw, but WOW I think that would be a hit. The sex position names are just so absurd. I mean, the licorice. 



From: <Kirk>, Chris <chris.kirk@slate.com>
Date: Tuesday, February 10, 2015 at 12:59 PM
To: Laura Bennett <laura.bennett@slate.com>
Subject: Re: Valentine's Day-related interactives

Here's an example of four "guess the name of this sex position" questions. (These images are plucked straight from Cosmo's website, which we probably can't do, but Art could probably make equivalent illustrations).

I'll start working on some "match the moan" example questions.

On Feb. 10, at 12:28 PM, Laura Bennett wrote:

Match the movie to the moaning disturbs me slightly, and would be NSFW (without headphones) which might limit its proliferation, but I still think it is a top notch idea.--kudos to both your brain and Amanda’s.

 

My fave was also “prescribe a rom-com to fix your relationship woes." 

 

I’d also like to see example Qs for “guess the name of this sex position,” needless to say

 

 

From: <Wickman>, Forrest <Forrest.Wickman@slate.com>
Date: Tuesday, February 10, 2015 at 11:31 AM
To: "Kirk, Chris" <chris.kirk@slate.com>, Laura Bennett <laura.bennett@slate.com>
Subject: Re: Valentine's Day-related interactives

 

Yeah that was the other main one I was intrigued by but I wasn’t sure if it’d be too creepy. Looping in LB here in case she has thoughts. Might help to see some example Qs?

 

From: <Kirk>, Chris Kirk <chris.kirk@slate.com>
Date: Tuesday, February 10, 2015 at 11:27 AM
To: Forrest Wickman <forrest.wickman@slate.com>
Subject: Re: Valentine's Day-related interactives

 

Also curious what others think about these. Right now, I'm finding the "for each sex position, select the name Cosmo hasn't given it over the years" idea difficult because libraries and lexis nexis only have issues going back a few years and the positions manage to be ever so slightly different (it's half-underwater this time!). This might be more doable: "For each sex position (as conveyed by a diagram), guess the name Cosmo has given it."

FWIW, I think "match the movie to the moaning" is so shuddersome that it'd be popular. Plus: Amanda Hess and I both thought of it independently.

On Feb. 09, at 09:01 PM, Forrest Wickman wrote:

Curious what others think, but these two are probably my favorite:

  • Calculator: Prescribe a rom com to fix your relationship woes.
  • For each sex position, select the name that Cosmo hasn't given it over the years.

 

From: <Bloomer>, Jeffrey <Jeffrey.Bloomer@slate.com>
Date: Monday, February 9, 2015 at 6:04 PM
To: Chris Kirk <chris.kirk@slate.com>, Browbeat <browbeat@slate.com>
Cc: Slate Interactives <slateinteractives@slate.com>
Subject: Re: Valentine's Day-related interactives

 

​When I was at Nerve, making fun of Cosmo sex tips was a Prudie-sized portion of our traffic. Never gets old. 

 

From: Kirk, Chris
Sent: Monday, February 9, 2015 5:59 PM
To: Browbeat
Cc: Slate Interactives
Subject: Valentine's Day-related interactives

 

Browbeat et al. — Let me know if you would like to see any of these ideas happen this week!

 

Quizzes:
  • Match the politician to the sext / sexually explicit message, e.g. Anthony Weiner, John Edwards, Warren Harding.
  • Match the sex position to the name Cosmo has given it. Or: For each sex position, select the name that Cosmo hasn't given it over the years.
  • Pick the fake Cosmo sex tip.
  • For each cynical interpretation of a real rom com, name the rom com.
  • Match the moaning to the movie (audio quiz). Or: Match the sex scene transcription to the movie.
  • Guess which celebrities dated a long time ago (see this Tumblr).
  • For each love song a celebrity wrote about another celebrity, guess who it was about (e.g. Taylor Swift's "Dear John" = John Mayer).

 

Other:

  • Rom com bingo.
  • Virtual sex dice. After a few rolls, the results turn nonsensical, dark, or extremely boring.
  • Calculator: Prescribe a rom com to fix your relationship woes.
  • Calculator: Which Cosmo sex tip should we try? Questions include: "Can you dislocate your arm with ease?" "Do you have pepper at hand?" "Do you enjoy eating body paint?"
